com.hannesdorfmann.mosby.mvp.delegate

Interface BaseMvpViewStateDelegateCallback<V extends MvpView,P extends MvpPresenter<V>>

  • All Superinterfaces:
    BaseMvpDelegateCallback<V,P>
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    ActivityMvpViewStateDelegateCallback<V,P>, MvpViewStateViewGroupDelegateCallback<V,P>
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    MvpLceViewStateActivity, MvpLceViewStateFragment, MvpViewStateActivity, MvpViewStateFragment, MvpViewStateFrameLayout, MvpViewStateLinearLayout, MvpViewStateRelativeLayout

    public interface BaseMvpViewStateDelegateCallback<V extends MvpView,P extends MvpPresenter<V>>
extends BaseMvpDelegateCallback<V,P>
    An enhanced version of BaseMvpDelegateCallback that adds ViewState support. This interface must be implemented by all (subclasses of) Activity, Fragmen or android.view.View that want to support ViewState and mvo.
    Since:
    1.0.0

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description

      Create the viewstate.
      ViewState<V> getViewState()
      Get the viewState

      Called if the ViewState instance has been restored successfully.

      • Methods inherited from interface com.hannesdorfmann.mosby.mvp.delegate.BaseMvpDelegateCallback

        createPresenter, getMvpView, getPresenter, isRetainInstance, setPresenter, setRetainInstance, shouldInstanceBeRetained

    • Method Detail

      • getViewState

        ViewState<V> getViewState()
        Get the viewState

      • setViewState

        void setViewState(ViewState<V> viewState)
        Set the viewstate. Should only be called by MvpViewStateInternalDelegate

      • createViewState

        ViewState<V> createViewState()
        Create the viewstate. Will be called by the MvpViewStateInternalDelegate.

      • setRestoringViewState

        void setRestoringViewState(boolean restoringViewState)
        This method will be called by MvpViewStateInternalDelegate to inform that restoring the view state is in progress.
        Parameters:
        restoringViewState - true, if restoring viewstate is in progress, otherwise false

      • isRestoringViewState

        boolean isRestoringViewState()
        Returns:
        true if the viewstate is restoring right now (not finished yet). Otherwise false.

      • onViewStateInstanceRestored

        void onViewStateInstanceRestored(boolean instanceStateRetained)
        Called if the ViewState instance has been restored successfully.

        In this method you have to restore the viewstate by reading the view state properties and setup the view to be on the same state as before.

        Parameters:
        instanceStateRetained - true, if the viewstate has been retained by usingFragment#setRetainInstance(boolean), otherwise false (always false for activities).

      • onNewViewStateInstance

        void onNewViewStateInstance()
        Called if a new ViewState has been created because no viewstate from a previous Activity or Fragment instance could be restored.

        Typically this is called on the first time the Activity or Fragment starts and therefore no view state instance previously exists
